oz..gloss: a unit of weight equal to one sixteenth of a pound or 16 drams or 28.349 grams

ozaena.gloss: a chronic disease of the nose characterized by a foul-smelling nasal discharge and atrophy of nasal structures

ozark chinkapin.gloss: shrubby tree closely related to the Allegheny chinkapin but with larger leaves

ozark chinquapin.gloss: shrubby tree closely related to the Allegheny chinkapin but with larger leaves

ozark mountains.gloss: an area of low mountains in northwestern Arkansas and southeastern Missouri and northeastern Oklahoma

ozark plateau.gloss: an area of low mountains in northwestern Arkansas and southeastern Missouri and northeastern Oklahoma

ozark sundrops.gloss: evening-opening primrose of south central United States

ozarks.gloss: an area of low mountains in northwestern Arkansas and southeastern Missouri and northeastern Oklahoma

ozawa.gloss: United States conductor (born in Japan in 1935)

ozena.gloss: a chronic disease of the nose characterized by a foul-smelling nasal discharge and atrophy of nasal structures

ozocerite.gloss: a waxy mineral that is a mixture of hydrocarbons and occurs in association with petroleum

ozokerite.gloss: a waxy mineral that is a mixture of hydrocarbons and occurs in association with petroleum

ozone layer.gloss: a layer in the stratosphere (at approximately 20 miles) that contains a concentration of ozone sufficient to block most ultraviolet radiation from the sun

ozonosphere.gloss: a layer in the stratosphere (at approximately 20 miles) that contains a concentration of ozone sufficient to block most ultraviolet radiation from the sun

ozothamnus.gloss: genus of Australian shrubs and perennial herbs

ozothamnus secundiflorus.gloss: shrub with white woolly branches and woolly leaves having fragrant flowers forming long sprays
